channel.title: Digg Content - Digg
channel.description: Digg Content on Digg: the best articles, videos, tweets, and original content that the web is talking about right now

item.title: The Job Losses Caused By The Coronavirus Pandemic Compared To Other Historical Periods Of Job Loss, Visualized
item.description: Over the last four weeks, more than 22 million people have filed jobless claims filed because of COVID-19. Here's how that compares to the numbers of other historical job losses over the past few decades.

item.title: Spain's Strangest Hotspots, And More Best Photography Of The Week
item.description: Living inside Brazil's largest apartment complex amid a pandemic, prophetic images of an empty world and other best photos of the week.

item.title: This Recreation Of 'The Office' In 'Animal Crossing' Is An Absolute Masterpiece
item.description: This the only remake of "The Office" we accept.
item.kicker: LET THIS BE A WHOLE SERIES

item.title: BBC Weatherman Closes Off His Forecast With Unexpected Drum Cover Of BBC's Outro Music
item.description: It's cloudy with 100% chance of a drum solo in the afternoon.

item.title: Where The World's Ultra-Rich Live, Broken Down By Country
item.description: Here are the nations where the people who are worth more than $30 million are residing.

item.title: We Can't Believe This Quibi Show Starring Rachel Brosnahan As A Woman Obsessed With Her Golden Arm Is Actually Real
item.description: Many of the Quibi shows that have come out seem pretty insane in terms of its premises, but we are still having a hard time not seeing this as a parody.

item.title: Here's A Genius Rendition Of 'Mr. Brightside' Sung In The Style Of The B-52s
item.description: Forget about "Love Shack." "Mr. Brightside" is actually the B-52s' best song ever.

item.title: A Secret Family History, Reconstructed In The Present, And More Best Photography Of The Week
item.description: The absurdity and humor of Siberia, the genius architecture of the Red Wall and more best photos of the week.

item.title: The Products That Have Seen The Biggest Online Shopping Increases Since The Pandemic Started, Charted
item.description: The COVID pandemic has led to some drastic changes in online shopping behavior. Here are the goods that people have buying more these days.

item.title: This Artist's Reimagining Of Disney Cartoons As Gory Horror Movies Is Ruining Our Childhoods
item.description: This is genius. This is horrifying.

item.title: The Price Changes Of Goods Compared To Wages In The US Over The Past 30 Years, Visualized
item.description: Here's a chart that shows how the increase of average hourly wages compares to the increases in goods and services such as healthcare, tuition and housing.

item.title: The Percentage Of American Workers In Each Income Bracket, Visualized
item.description: According to the data, more than half of workers in the US earn less than $50,000 a year.

item.title: The People Staying And Living In America's Motels, And More Best Photography Of The Week
item.description: The inside world of Irish traveler children, a testosterone-fueled pool hall in Chicago and more best photos of the week.

item.title: This Statistical Personality Test That Shows Which Fictional Characters You Are Most Similar To Is Incredibly Comprehensive
item.description: Covering 121 questions (or 28, if you're in a rush) and 400 characters, this test isn't your regular BuzzFeed personality quiz.

item.title: This Twitter Thread Of Animals That Look Like PokÃ©mon Might Be The Most Delightful Thing You See Today
item.description: Rebecca Helm, a biology professor at the University of North Carolina Asheville who specializes in jellyfish, put together an eye-popping Twitter thread of real world animals that she deemed "should be Pokemon."

item.title: This App That Turns Your Photos In Paintings In The Style Of Famous Artists Is A Perfect Way To Waste Some Time
item.description: Even seemingly ordinary photos can look extraordinary when you transform it in the style of a Van Gogh or an Andy Warhol.

item.title: A Chart Showing How Long It Took For Coronavirus To Become The Leading Daily Cause Of Death In The US
item.description: Here's how the number of people killed by COVID-19 has changed from March 1 to April 8 and how that compares with the average numbers of the top 15 leading causes of death in the US.

item.title: Life In Earth's Deepest Deep Freeze, And More Best Photography Of The Week
item.description: The weird and wonderful world of British car boot sales, a journey to Japan's centuries-old festivals and more best photos of the week.

item.title: The Most Successful Video Game Franchises Of All Time By Revenue, Visualized
item.description: The global video game industry makes bank, grossing an estimated $150 billion in 2019. Just like Hollywood, the video game world has some trusty franchises they can rely on for steady revenue. Here are the top video game series of all time.

item.title: What We're Buying For Quarantine, And More Best Photography Of The Week
item.description: The world's only pink manta ray, the last party in London before lockdown and more best photos of the week.

item.title: The Banff Film Festival Tour Was Canceled By Coronavirus, But Here Are Some Of The Best Shorts (For Free)
item.description: Just some great, beautiful shorts about the outdoors.
item.kicker: A BREATH OF FRESH, MOUNTAIN AIR

item.title: 'Reply All' Helps Man Remember An Obscure Pop Song In Roller Coaster Of A Podcast Episode
item.description: This week on "Reply All," listener Tyler Gillett recalls an un-Googleable song from his childhood — even the lyrics and the melody — and reaches out to PJ Vogt for help.

item.title: The Richest Person In Every American State, Visualized
item.description: The rich get richer, and everyone else seemingly less so. As income inequality continues to be a problem in the United States, what better time to find out who the biggest fat cats in America are — specifically, who are the richest people in your state?

item.title: The Extreme Contrast Of Summer And Winter In Alaska, And More Best Photography Of The Week
item.description: The profound loneliness of New York subway platforms, vintage scenes of life at an American summer camp and other best photos of the week.

item.title: The Many Different Emojis For Saturn, Ranked By A Planetary Scientist
item.description: Which emoji actually nails the look of the planet in a scientifically accurate fashion?

item.title: The Colossal Underbelly Of An Iceberg, And More Best Photography Of The Week
item.description: Vintage photos of badass women riding their choppers, imagining a bleak future without humans and more best photos of the week.

item.title: Man Unearths Huey Lewis Covers He Made On His Commodore 64 Back In The 1980s
item.description: A man who was really obsessed with Huey Lewis and the News back in the day discovered all of the chiptune-esque covers of his songs he created on Commodore 64 with the "Music Construction Set" program and uploaded them to YouTube.

item.title: This Map Shows What Each State's Favorite Other State Is And It's Priceless
item.description: Turns out many states have complicated love-hate relationships with each other. Well, except for Minnesota, a state that loves Canada best.

item.title: The 100 Most Valuable Brands In The World, Visualized
item.description: There's been quite a bit of shuffling of the top 10 most valuable companies in the world this year compared to last year.

item.title: This 10-Second Video Shows How Much The Population Density In The US Has Changed In The Past 200 Years
item.description: it's 200 years of population migration and growth history captured in 10 seconds.

item.title: A Fascinating Diagram Breaking Down The 100 Most-Spoken Languages In The World
item.description: Mandarin and English are the most-spoken languages in the world, but the fuller picture is far more complicated and more interesting.

item.title: Burger King Is Embracing Mold In Extremely Disgusting Whopper Ad Campaign
item.description: When you're making the case for the public to choose your fast food establishment over a competitor, "mold" is the last thing you'd want on customers' minds, but Burger King is going all in.

item.title: Is Alex Garland's Mind-Bending Sci-Fi Show 'Devs' Any Good? Here's What The Reviews Say
item.description: Is the sci-fi show, created by "Ex Machina" and "Annihilation" director Alex Garland and starring Nick Offerman, a hallucinatory mind-bender or is the show too esoteric for its own good? Here's what the reviews say.

item.title: The Cars That Depreciate The Most After Their First Year, Visualized
item.description: After you drive a car off the dealership lot, the vehicle tends to immediately lose value but some depreciate much faster than others.

item.title: How Can I Convince My Boyfriend To Stop Eating Raw Hamburger Meat, And Other Advice Column Questions
item.description: A roundup of the most interesting, thought-provoking and surprising questions that our favorite columnists addressed in recent days.

item.title: Who Dated Whom On 'The Office,' Visualized
item.description: "The Office" — which ran for 201 episodes on NBC from 2005 to 2013 — featured a lot of, er, inter-office romances. Here is a nifty chart chronicling all of them.

item.title: How Three Senior Citizens Ended Up In A Love Triangle, And More Best Photography Of The Week

item.description: From a SpaceX rocket exhaust plume captured above the Sierra Nevada mountains to stunning images of deserts and the Badlands.

item.title: Is The 'Sonic The Hedgehog' Movie Any Good? Here's What The Reviews Say
item.description: The movie famously had to go through a complete redesign of its main character after fan backlash. Does the redesign of the movie save it or is "Sonic the Hedgehog" a slog? Here's what the reviews say.

item.title: Is Motorola's New Foldable Razr Phone Any Good? Here's What The Reviews Say
item.description: The Motorola Razr was the iconic phone of the pre-iPhone era, and now Motorola is bringing it back with a folding screen. Is it any good?

item.title: 40 Days Of Arctic Circle Darkness, And More Best Photography Of The Week
item.description: "Glamorous" Brits making their way to the races, Bernie Sanders at a sit-in 58 years ago and more best photos of the week.

item.description: Good reviews are all alike; every bad review is bonkers in its own unique way.

item.description: Trying to navigate your way around pizza rats, abandoned mattresses and lots and lots of trash is just a super normal day in New York,

item.title: Is 'Birds Of Prey' Any Good? Here's What The Reviews Say
item.description: "Birds of Prey" is our first superhero movie of 2020. Is it as good as "Wonder Woman" or as disappointing as "Suicide Squad"? Here's what the reviews say.

item.description: Two stars had a cosmic confrontation and one star ended up engulfing the other.

item.title: The Best 2020 Super Bowl Commercials (And A Few Of The Worst)
item.description: It's the most wonderful time of year: when brands drop tens of millions of dollars to get 60 seconds of your attention during the Super bowl.
